Villa Ghigi is a public park in Bologna, located close to the urban area. Part of the park is used for agricultural land and, recently, for grazing.
Parco di Via dei Giardini (della Ca\' Bura)

It extends over 9 hectares around a central axis that connects a square between two large artificial hills paved with a gazebo that juts out over a large stretch of water. The pond is the heart of the park and recalls the era in which around the Navile clay kilns and quarries flourished.

It is the largest and most popular city park. Designed by Sambuy from Piedmont, to provide Bologna with a large public green space based on the example of the major Italian and European cities, it was inaugurated in 1879 with the name of Passeggio Regina Margherita (as a tribute to the wife of Umberto I).

The Basilica of San Petronio is the main church of Bologna: it dominates the Piazza Maggiore and, although it is largely unfinished, it is one of the largest churches in Europe. Its imposing size makes it the fourth largest church in Italy.
The Neptune fountain, nicknamed al Żigànt (Gigante in Italian: Giant in English) in the Bolognese dialect due to the size of the statue of Neptune, is located in Bologna in piazza del Nettuno.

The Garisenda and Asinelli tower are the so-called two towers of Bologna, symbol of the city, located at the intersection of the ancient streets San Donato (now via Zamboni), San Vitale, Maggiore, Santo Stefano and Castiglione.

The museum is one of the most important Italian archaeological collections and is highly representative of local history, from prehistory to the Roman age. His collection of Egyptian antiquities is one of the most important in Europe. Between 1972 and 2012 the Museum hosted over 150 exhibitions and exhibitions of an archaeological and artistic nature.

The Museum of the Resistance of Bologna is located in the convent complex of San Mattia and collects different types of material (archive documents, photographs, posters, multimedia products) related to the history of anti-fascism, the Bolognese Resistance and republican Italy.
TPalazzo Pepoli, also known as the Museums of History of Bologna, is a historic building located in the center of Bologna near the two towers, in Via Castiglione.
